61.text: Felicia Browne was born in London in 1904,

64.text: in a relatively prosperous middle class family.

67.text: She went to the Slade School to study art in the 1920s

71.text: but probably the main turning point in her life was in 1928

75.text: when she went to study sculpture in Berlin because it coincided with the rise of Nazism

81.text: and she was drawn into the anti-fascist politics of that time.

87.text: When Felicia Browne returned from Berlin she joined the communist party

91.text: and she came under surveillance from MI5

93.text: who then monitored her career until her departure for Spain in 1936.
